title: Extended and refreshed my site about the Fell Types.
content:
Hello. This summer I've been introduced to Wordpress and I liked it. So I decided to use it for my sites. I've begun with the site about the [Fell Types](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015184032/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fell%20Types). Essentially I've added a page about their history. It's far to be exhaustive but it's better than nothing. I think I will use the Wordpress' "post mechanism" to add other infos easily (doing something I haven't done for years!).

I hope you like it.

Igino Marini
author: iginomarini

comments.content: A link, please, Igino! Would love to see the new site.

Igino,

I do like it. You've done a great job "giving life" to these historical faces.

Salute!

Hey Igino great work with everything, keep up the fascinating work.

Dave

Now that you have gone to all this trouble to design and publish the site, you should have the text corrected by an English editor, as it "reads" with a pronounced accent. Perhaps an Anglophone Typophile will volunteer, if you post a request.
Given that the fonts are free I think we should simply be grateful that he has done all this work. That said, it is always good to have a text that reads well.

Hi there,

I just stumble on your IM Fell Types the other day. Thank You! I will let you know about something I thought I could cook with them.

_Given that the fonts are free I think we should simply be grateful that he has done all this work._

But what if you don't get a job with Microsoft or Adobe?
I don't think that Igino's revival will have much impact on that dynamic.
